page.title: 07TRANSPORT IN KETTLEWELL
page.content: There is at present a daily service by West Yorkshire Bus Company from Skipton of four buses each day, none on Sundays in the winter. Grammar School children catch the early (7.30 a.m.) bus to Skipton, returning on the last bus at 5 p.m. A private company is in process of negotiating for the franchise. Some summer Sunday services cater for travel to Hawes and Keld. The local garage runs a school bus for pupils at the primary school and at Upper Wharfedale taking a complicated route to pick up children from Cray, Langstrothdale and Littondale. The main road through the village is the B.6160 with a side road to Coverdale and beyond via the dangerous Park Rash. Private cars are almost essential, and older residents and non drivers rely on friends for help.
